str2: Therefore, then. Apparently a primary word; certainly, or accordingly.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: A prolonged form of a primary verb; to 'know' in a great variety of applications and with many implications.
Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: A strengthened form of melo; to intend, i.e. Be about to be, do, or suffer something.

parse: Verb - Present Infinitive Middle or Passive
Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: (a) I make, manufacture, construct, (b) I do, act, cause. Apparently a prolonged form of an obsolete primary; to make or do.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
A king, ruler, but in some passages clearly to be translated: emperor. Probably from basis; a sovereign.
To seize, snatch, obtain by robbery. From a derivative of haireomai; to seize.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From ana and choreo; to retire.
Probably from the same as pale; anew, i.e. back, once more, or furthermore or on the other hand.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
A mountain, hill. Probably from an obsolete oro; a mountain: -hill, mount(-ain).

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
